definition: the Book of Dao by Laozi or Lao-Tze, the sacred text of Daoism

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
variant of 德[de2]
variant of 德[de2]
virtue/goodness/morality/ethics/kindness/favor/character/kind
Germany/German/abbr. for 德國|德国[De2 guo2]
classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
surname Jing

sentences.english: This chapter of Tao Te Ching is usually being called Great Conformity.
sentences.chinese: 这篇道德经一般人称之谓大顺。

sentences.english: Lao Tze's philosophy contains the perfect ecosystem intelligence and the humanities spirit.
sentences.chinese: 古老的《道德经》蕴含着完善的生态智慧和人文精神。

sentences.english: The tao-te handed down for the first Taoist books.
sentences.chinese: 《道德经》为道教始祖老子唯一传世的著作。

sentences.english: Laotse, "The Old Boy, " always emphasized in his Taotehching the unearned rock.
sentences.chinese: 老子在他的《道德经》里始终看重不雕琢的石头。

sentences.english: TTC Lao Tzu. Tao Te Ching. Reference is to section number.
sentences.chinese: 《道德经》，引述时标记的数位指的是每一节的编号。

sentences.english: Can foreigners understand Dao De Jing?
sentences.chinese: 外国人能读懂道德经吗？

sentences.english: The book, Tao Te Ching, has been translated into many languages.
sentences.chinese: 他写的《道德经》被译成许多种不同的文字。

sentences.english: And what does the Dao De Jing say about this?
sentences.chinese: 对此，《道德经》怎样说的呢？

definition: The Book of Changes ("I Ching")
The Analects of Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]
Xiaojing (Classic of Filial Piety)
Yi Zhuan, commentary on the "Book of Changes" or "I Ching" 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
The Yellow Emperor's Internal Canon, medical text c. 300 BC
Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
Huangting Jing, one of the primary scriptures of Daoism
cosmology
“Art of War”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], written by Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sun1 zi3]
philosophical book by Song dynasty scholar Zhou Dunyi 周敦頤|周敦颐[Zhou1 Dun1 yi2], starting from an interpretation of the Book of Changes
Buddhist texts/scripture
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)

the Thirteen Confucian Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Rites of Zhou 周禮|周礼[Zhou1 li3], Rites and Ceremonies 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Mr Zuo's Annals 左傳|左传[Zuo3 Zhuan4], Mr Gongyang's Annals 公羊傳|公羊传[Gong1 yang2 Zhuan4], Mr Guliang's Annals 穀梁傳|谷梁传[Gu3 liang2 Zhuan4], The Analects 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], Erya 爾雅|尔雅[Er3 ya3], Classic of Filial Piety 孝經|孝经[Xiao4 jing1], Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3]
Avatamsaka sutra of the Huayan school/also called Buddhavatamsaka-mahavaipulya Sutra, the Flower adornment sutra or the Garland sutra
